basics.name: Giovanni Ravalico
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: I am a Software Developer, a geek and more generally a problem solver. I am also a young father of two and a devoted husband. My transition from the social sciences to software engineering has enhanced my innate curiosity, my pragmatic approach, and desire to find new ways to solve old problems. I’m looking to work in an environment where I can continuously grow as a developer, where experimentation is encouraged and where I can tackle the hardest problems.

work.name: ToolTime Gmbh
work.summary: A software-as-a-service solution that helps craftsmen tackle all administrative tasks of their business.
highlights: Design, build, scale and maintain ToolTime’s software solutions (Frontend: Typescript, React and React Native, GraphQL)
Help shaping the technical areas of the product
Work closely with product managers, product designers, frontend and backend engineers
Help to grow and develop the front-end team, playing a role in the process of hiring new team members
Foster a culture of continuous delivery and test-driven development
Solving challenging problems in the areas of: communication & chat, scheduling & disposition, routing & navigation, order management and documentation
Tech: [Typescript, React and React Native, CSS-in-JS, GraphQL]

work.name: Appico Gmbh
work.summary: From Jan 2018 to Dec 2018 I worked on Carie™. A two-dimensional telemedicine platform that enables doctors to interact with patients and other doctors remotely by scheduling appointments, and allows messaging, video consultation, online medication prescription, and file sharing.
highlights: Architected of the front-end as a Progressive Single Page App built with React, Redux, and Apollo (GraphQL client) to enable a resilient user experience.
Lead the front-end team (a small group of talents)
Managed project tasks and issues by delegating them to the most effective developer and thus increasing team efficiency.
Motivated my team to enforce type safety by teaching “Flow” and thus reducing the number of bug reports.
Introduced “component driven development” company-wide by coaching the designer team. The adoption of this practice and `Storybook` lead to a more streamlined development process.
Delivered and maintained the MVP since Oct 2018.
Studied React Native by implementing several in house app prototypes. By sharing this knowledge the company was able to offer a new service to its customers. (since Jan 2019)
Develop a boilerplate project setup based on company requirements and best practices which allowed to reduce the time needed to go from idea to prototype.
Tech: [ ESNext, TypeScript, Flow, React, React Native, Redux, Storybook, Apollo, GraphQL, styled-components, Lottie, Jest, Twilio, AWS IoT, Serverless, Node, AWS Lambda, Docker ]
